questions.name: Field Completeness
questions.description: Proportion of mandatory schema fields populated (e.g., id, title, description, keywords, license).
questions.evidence: id: https://doi.org/10.13026/249v-w155, title: Bridge2AI-Voice..., description: 420 chars, keywords: 12 keywords, license_and_use_terms: detailed
questions.quality_note: All mandatory fields present with comprehensive content

questions.name: Entry Length Adequacy
questions.description: Checks whether narrative fields (e.g., description, motivation) have meaningful content length.
questions.evidence: description: 420 characters, motivation: N/A (not a mandatory field for this dataset)
questions.quality_note: Description exceeds 200 characters with comprehensive dataset overview

questions.name: Keyword Diversity
questions.description: Number of unique keywords provided to describe dataset topic coverage.
questions.evidence: keywords: [Bridge2AI, voice biomarker, speech, health, voice disorders, neurological disorders, mood disorders, respiratory disorders, spectrogram, MFCC, acoustic features, PhysioNet]
questions.quality_note: 12 unique keywords covering domain, methods, conditions, and platform

questions.name: File Enumeration and Type Variety
questions.description: Number of files and file type diversity in distribution_formats or files.listing.
questions.evidence: distribution_formats: Parquet, TSV, JSON formats
questions.quality_note: 3 standard file formats provided (Parquet, TSV, JSON)

questions.name: Data File Size Availability
questions.description: Presence of file size or dimensional metadata in files section (e.g., 513×N spectrogram).
questions.evidence: spectrograms: 513 x N dimension, mfcc: 60 x N dimension
questions.quality_note: Dimensional metadata provided for spectrograms and MFCCs

questions.name: Dataset Identification Metadata
questions.description: Presence of unique identifiers such as DOI, RRID, or persistent URLs.
questions.evidence: doi: https://doi.org/10.13026/249v-w155, page: https://physionet.org/content/b2ai-voice/1.1/
questions.quality_note: DOI and persistent URL both present

questions.name: Funding and Acknowledgements Completeness
questions.description: Checks presence of funding sources, grants, or institutional sponsors.
questions.evidence: No funding_and_acknowledgements field found
questions.quality_note: Missing funding agency and grant information

questions.name: Ethical and Privacy Declarations
questions.description: Presence of deidentification methods, IRB approvals, or ethical sourcing notes.
questions.score_label: IRB approval + deidentification + ethical sourcing details
questions.evidence: ethics.irb_approval: University of South Florida IRB, deidentification_and_privacy.approach: HIPAA Safe Harbor, ethical_reviews with detailed notes
questions.quality_note: Comprehensive ethical documentation with IRB approval, HIPAA deidentification, and ethical sourcing details

questions.name: Access Requirements Documentation
questions.description: Determines if access policy and license are clearly defined (open, registered, restricted).
questions.score_label: License + Data Use Agreement + platform access description
questions.evidence: license_and_use_terms: Bridge2AI Voice Registered Access License with DUA requirement, access via PhysioNet
questions.quality_note: Clear license, DUA requirement, and platform access path fully documented

questions.name: Interoperability and Standardization
questions.description: Presence of standard formats, ontologies, or schema conformance (e.g., Parquet, TSV, LinkML).
questions.score_label: Standard format but no schema reference
questions.evidence: data_formats: Parquet, TSV, JSON (all standard formats)
questions.quality_note: Standard formats used but no explicit schema/ontology conformance (conforms_to) field

questions.name: Tool and Software Transparency
questions.description: Mentions of preprocessing libraries or tools used in data preparation.
questions.score_label: At least one preprocessing tool listed
questions.evidence: software_and_tools: openSMILE, Praat, parselmouth, torchaudio, OpenAI Whisper
questions.quality_note: Multiple tools listed but without version numbers or GitHub links

questions.name: Collection Protocol Clarity
questions.description: Evaluates description completeness of participant recruitment and data acquisition.
questions.evidence: collection_process: standardized protocol, five sites, specialty clinics
questions.quality_note: General collection setting described but missing detailed recruitment procedures and site-specific protocols

questions.name: Version History Documentation
questions.description: Presence of multiple version records and associated dates.
questions.score_label: ≥2 versions with change summaries and release dates
questions.quality_note: 4 versions documented with release dates and change summaries (e.g., v1.1 added MFCCs)

questions.name: Associated Publications
questions.description: Presence of formal citations or DOI-linked references.
questions.evidence: No references or citations field found
questions.quality_note: Missing DOI links to related publications or dataset papers

questions.name: Human Subject Representation
questions.description: Indicates inclusion of human subjects, demographic diversity, or subgroup details.
questions.evidence: composition.population: 306 adult participants, subpopulations: voice disorders, neurological disorders, mood disorders, respiratory disorders with detailed descriptions
questions.quality_note: Comprehensive participant demographics with clear subpopulation breakdown and condition groups

questions.name: Findability (Persistent Links)
questions.description: Dataset includes persistent URLs for access and documentation.
questions.evidence: page: https://physionet.org/content/b2ai-voice/1.1/, download_url implied via PhysioNet
questions.quality_note: Persistent URL provided via PhysioNet landing page

questions.name: Accessibility (Access Mechanism)
questions.description: Describes how users can obtain the dataset (download, DUA, login).
questions.score_label: Fully defined access path (platform, login, policy)
questions.evidence: distribution_formats: PhysioNet registered access, license_and_use_terms: DUA required, registered access process
questions.quality_note: Complete access pathway documented: PhysioNet registration + DUA signing + download

questions.name: Reusability (License Clarity)
questions.description: License is clearly defined and permits identifiable reuse cases.
questions.evidence: license_and_use_terms: Bridge2AI Voice Registered Access License with explicit terms for research data sharing
questions.quality_note: License clearly defined with specific reuse terms for research purposes

questions.name: Data Integrity and Provenance
questions.description: Presence of change logs or provenance tracking (e.g., versioned documentation).
questions.evidence: updates.update_details: v1.1 released 2025-01-17, v2.0.0 released 2025-04-16, v2.0.1 released 2025-08-18 with specific dates and changes
questions.quality_note: Well-structured version control with timestamps and change descriptions

questions.name: Interlinking Across Platforms
questions.description: Metadata connects dataset records across multiple platforms (e.g., FAIRhub + PhysioNet).
questions.evidence: No external_resources with cross-platform links found
questions.quality_note: Missing links to related platforms (GitHub, FAIRhub, Bridge2AI portal)

strengths: Excellent structural completeness with all mandatory fields populated and comprehensive descriptions (>200 chars)
Strong ethical documentation including IRB approval, HIPAA Safe Harbor deidentification, and informed consent procedures
Clear FAIR compliance with DOI, persistent URLs, registered access mechanism, and well-defined license terms
Comprehensive version history with 4 documented releases (v1.0 through v2.0.1) including dates and change notes
Detailed human subject representation with 306 participants across 4 condition groups and demographic details
weaknesses: Missing funding and acknowledgements section (no NIH grant details or award numbers)
No associated publication DOIs or formal citations in references field
Limited interoperability documentation (no explicit schema conformance or conforms_to field)
Preprocessing tools listed without version numbers or repository links
No cross-platform interlinking to related resources (GitHub, FAIRhub, Bridge2AI portal)
recommendations: Add funding_and_acknowledgements.funding with NIH Bridge2AI grant information (agency, award number, acknowledgements)
Include references section with DOIs to related publications and dataset papers
Add conforms_to field specifying schema conformance (e.g., LinkML D4D schema, schema.org Dataset)
Document software_and_tools with version numbers and GitHub repository links (openSMILE 3.0, Whisper large-v3, etc.)
Add external_resources with cross-platform links (Bridge2AI portal, project GitHub, related datasets)
